body:
Comment 1: 
see:
http://tip.golang.org/ref/spec#Package_clause
http://tip.golang.org/ref/spec#identifier

there are two concepts here:
1. the package name: it should be a proper Go identifier, that is, it shouldn't be a
reserved word.
2. the import path: it is a string, and Go spec says the interpretation of the string is
implementation-dependent.

that is, you can have a package with import path "myproject/struct", but its package
name can't
be struct which is a reserved word.
_Status changed to **WorkingAsIntended**._
